title: Some 15,000 starving Christian soldiers begin the siege of Jerusalem by marching in a religious procession around the city as its Muslim defenders watch.
text: Some 15,000 starving Christian soldiers begin the siege of Jerusalem by marching in a religious procession around the city as its Muslim defenders watch.

title: Roger of Lauria, commanding the Aragonese fleet defeats an Angevin fleet sent to put down a rebellion on Malta.
text: Roger of Lauria, commanding the Aragonese fleet defeats an Angevin fleet sent to put down a rebellion on Malta.

title: Vasco da Gama sets sail on the first direct European voyage to India.
text: Vasco da Gama sets sail on the first direct European voyage to India.

title: Our Lady of Kazan, a holy icon of the Russian Orthodox Church, is discovered underground in the city of Kazan, Tatarstan.
text: Our Lady of Kazan, a holy icon of the Russian Orthodox Church, is discovered underground in the city of Kazan, Tatarstan.

title: Imjin War: At the Battle of Hansan Island, the Korean Navy, led by Yi Sun-sin, Yi Eok-gi, and Won Gyun, decisively defeats the Japanese Navy, led by Wakisaka Yasuharu.
text: Imjin War: At the Battle of Hansan Island, the Korean Navy, led by Yi Sun-sin, Yi Eok-gi, and Won Gyun, decisively defeats the Japanese Navy, led by Wakisaka Yasuharu.

title: Charles II of England grants John Clarke a Royal charter to Rhode Island.
text: Charles II of England grants John Clarke a Royal charter to Rhode Island.

title: Peter I of Russia defeats Charles XII of Sweden at the Battle of Poltava, thus effectively ending Sweden's status as a major power in Europe.
text: Peter I of Russia defeats Charles XII of Sweden at the Battle of Poltava, thus effectively ending Sweden's status as a major power in Europe.

title: The Battle of Dynekilen forces Sweden to abandon its invasion of Norway.
text: The Battle of Dynekilen forces Sweden to abandon its invasion of Norway.

title: An estimated magnitude 8.7 earthquake causes a tsunami that damages more than 1,000 km (620 mi) of Chile's coastline.
text: An estimated magnitude 8.7 earthquake causes a tsunami that damages more than 1,000 km (620 mi) of Chile's coastline.

title: French forces hold Fort Carillon against the British at Ticonderoga, New York.
text: French forces hold Fort Carillon against the British at Ticonderoga, New York.

title: British forces defeat French forces in the last naval battle in New France.
text: British forces defeat French forces in the last naval battle in New France.

title: The Olive Branch Petition is signed by the Continental Congress of the Thirteen Colonies of North America.
text: The Olive Branch Petition is signed by the Continental Congress of the Thirteen Colonies of North America.

title: Church bells (possibly including the Liberty Bell) are rung after John Nixon delivers the first public reading of the Declaration of Independence of the United States.
text: Church bells (possibly including the Liberty Bell) are rung after John Nixon delivers the first public reading of the Declaration of Independence of the United States.

title: Joseph Bonaparte approves the Bayonne Statute, a royal charter intended as the basis for his rule as king of Spain.
text: Joseph Bonaparte approves the Bayonne Statute, a royal charter intended as the basis for his rule as king of Spain.

title: Chippewas turn over a huge tract of land in Ontario to the United Kingdom.
text: Chippewas turn over a huge tract of land in Ontario to the United Kingdom.

title: The Perry Expedition arrives in Edo Bay with a treaty requesting trade.
text: The Perry Expedition arrives in Edo Bay with a treaty requesting trade.

title: King Charles XV & IV accedes to the throne of Sweden–Norway.
text: King Charles XV & IV accedes to the throne of Sweden–Norway.

title: Ikedaya Incident: The Choshu Han shishi's planned Shinsengumi sabotage on Kyoto, Japan at Ikedaya.
text: Ikedaya Incident: The Choshu Han shishi's planned Shinsengumi sabotage on Kyoto, Japan at Ikedaya.

title: The Mounties begin their March West.
text: The Mounties begin their March West.

title: White supremacists kill five Black Republicans in Hamburg, South Carolina.
text: White supremacists kill five Black Republicans in Hamburg, South Carolina.

title: Sailing ship USS Jeannette departs San Francisco carrying an ill-fated expedition to the North Pole.
text: Sailing ship USS Jeannette departs San Francisco carrying an ill-fated expedition to the North Pole.

title: The first issue of The Wall Street Journal is published.
text: The first issue of The Wall Street Journal is published.

title: St. John's, Newfoundland is devastated in the Great Fire of 1892.
text: St. John's, Newfoundland is devastated in the Great Fire of 1892.

title: The death of crime boss Soapy Smith, killed in the Shootout on Juneau Wharf, releases Skagway, Alaska from his iron grip.
text: The death of crime boss Soapy Smith, killed in the Shootout on Juneau Wharf, releases Skagway, Alaska from his iron grip.

title: Henrique Mitchell de Paiva Couceiro leads an unsuccessful royalist attack against the First Portuguese Republic in Chaves.
text: Henrique Mitchell de Paiva Couceiro leads an unsuccessful royalist attack against the First Portuguese Republic in Chaves.

title: The Dow Jones Industrial Average reaches its lowest level of the Great Depression, closing at 41.22.
text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average reaches its lowest level of the Great Depression, closing at 41.22.

title: The first rugby union test match between the Wallabies of Australia and the Springboks of South Africa is played at Newlands Stadium in Cape Town.
text: The first rugby union test match between the Wallabies of Australia and the Springboks of South Africa is played at Newlands Stadium in Cape Town.

title: Turkey, Iran, Iraq and Afghanistan sign the Treaty of Saadabad.
text: Turkey, Iran, Iraq and Afghanistan sign the Treaty of Saadabad.

title: Reports are broadcast that a UFO crash landed in Roswell, New Mexico in what became known as the Roswell UFO incident.
text: Reports are broadcast that a UFO crash landed in Roswell, New Mexico in what became known as the Roswell UFO incident.

title: The United States Air Force accepts its first female recruits into a program called Women in the Air Force (WAF).
text: The United States Air Force accepts its first female recruits into a program called Women in the Air Force (WAF).

title: Francis Gary Powers is charged with espionage resulting from his flight over the Soviet Union.
text: Francis Gary Powers is charged with espionage resulting from his flight over the Soviet Union.

title: Ne Win besieges and dynamites the Rangoon University Student Union building to crush the Student Movement.
text: Ne Win besieges and dynamites the Rangoon University Student Union building to crush the Student Movement.

title: King Mwambutsa IV Bangiriceng of Burundi is deposed by his son Prince Charles Ndizi.
text: King Mwambutsa IV Bangiriceng of Burundi is deposed by his son Prince Charles Ndizi.

title: The Chrysler wildcat strike begins in Detroit, Michigan.
text: The Chrysler wildcat strike begins in Detroit, Michigan.

title: Richard Nixon delivers a special congressional message enunciating Native American self-determination as official US Indian policy, leading to the Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act of 1975.
text: Richard Nixon delivers a special congressional message enunciating Native American self-determination as official US Indian policy, leading to the Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act of 1975.

title: Israeli Mossad assassinate Palestinian writer Ghassan Kanafani.
text: Israeli Mossad assassinate Palestinian writer Ghassan Kanafani.

title: The inaugural 1980 State of Origin game is won by Queensland who defeat New South Wales 20-10 at Lang Park.
text: The inaugural 1980 State of Origin game is won by Queensland who defeat New South Wales 20-10 at Lang Park.

title: Assassination attempt against Iraqi president Saddam Hussein in Dujail.
text: Assassination attempt against Iraqi president Saddam Hussein in Dujail.

title: The Island Express train travelling from Bangalore to Kanyakumari derails on the Peruman bridge and falls into Ashtamudi Lake, killing 105 passengers and injuring over 200 more.
text: The Island Express train travelling from Bangalore to Kanyakumari derails on the Peruman bridge and falls into Ashtamudi Lake, killing 105 passengers and injuring over 200 more.

title: Kim Jong-il begins to assume supreme leadership of North Korea upon the death of his father, Kim Il-sung.

title: Space Shuttle Atlantis is launched in the final mission of the U.S. Space Shuttle program.
text: Space Shuttle Atlantis is launched in the final mission of the U.S. Space Shuttle program.

title: Israel launches an offensive on Gaza amid rising tensions following the kidnapping and murder of three Israeli teenagers.
